speaker: DEPUTY WRIGHT
line: We have a fire off county road D7. Two miles west of the canyon ridge intersection. Suggest we dispatch fire crews. This is Deputy Wright. Do you copy? Son of a.... Walks around car towards explosion

speaker: MALE OFFICER #1
line: Sir? Sorry to disturb you sir. But we just picked up an unidentified bogey. I think you should see the replay for yourself.

speaker: MALE OFFICER #1
line: It tripped the fence at 23-17 off the coast of Conneticut, sir.

speaker: CAPTAIN KORETZ
line: Initial trajectory was north by northwest. Then it started going crazy.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: What about other craft in the area...missle testing?

speaker: CAPTAIN KORETZ
line: Sir. No known aircraft can maneuver like this.

speaker: MALE OFFICER #1
line: Well, whatever it was dropped of the screen at 24-18 sir. Hit ground just west of Lake Michigan outside Townsend Wisconsin.

speaker: CAPTAIN KORETZ
line: The tracking and impact team predicted impact calculated at over 800 miles an hour.

speaker: MALE OFFICER #1
line: I've instructed Cheif Koretz to to start her report right away...

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Negative. What she tracked was a meteor. Its abberant movement was obviously due to instrument malfunction.

speaker: CAPTAIN KORETZ
line: But sir...

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Your report will reflect these facts. Is that clear?

speaker: MALE OFFICER #1
line: Yes sir.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Good.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Code indigo delta echo niner. I have a confirmed fallen angel in sector 87. Mobilize Operation Falcon Immediately.

speaker: DEPUTY WRIGHT
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Then what happened out there if it wasn't a train wreck?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Mulder the continental United States is surrounded by an electronic fence that reaches 15,000 miles into space. We use it to track and monitor the 7,087 man-made objects that orbit the earth. Last night at 23-17 that fence was breached.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: This morning at 0100 Operation Falcon went into effect Led by Colonel Calvin Henderson--The Air Force's premiere reclamations expert.

speaker: MULDER
line: Reclamations?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: During the cold war his job was to prevent technologies from downed US aircrafts from getting into Soviet hands.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's part of a craft retrieval unit.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Mm Hmm. Quick response. I'd say you have...24 Hours before the entire area is sanitized. After that it will be like nothing has happened.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: You're late, Liutenant.. Its going to be dark in a half hour.

speaker: LIEUTENANT
line: We had a flat outside the peremiter, sir.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: There's a general briefing at 2200 hours. But first got to headquarters for the live rounds.

speaker: LIEUTENANT
line: Live rounds, sir?

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: You have a problem with that?

speaker: LIEUTENANT
line: No sir. We were told this was just a drill.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: They told you wrong.

speaker: LIEUTENANT
line: OK! Everyone out! Mulder drops from bottom of truck, walks into forest. Forest at night. Armed soldiers walk through on patrol. Mulder walks by. Mulder sees light in distance, walks toward it. Approaching lit area, crouches down. Men yelling. Whooshing noises. Mulder sees crash site lit with heavy lights. Men walk around crash site in protective gear spray area. Mulder takes photos of this scene. Man approaches Mulder from behind. Mulder turns around, is hit in face with gun.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: You just made the worst mistake of your life, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you knocked out a filling.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: I'll see to it you that pay the price for putting my men at risk.

speaker: MULDER
line: Since when does taking pictures put anyone's life at risk?

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: You violated a US government quarantine and thats a federal crime.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's a quarantine? Is that what you call this?

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: We're trying to contain an ecological disaster.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thats a lot of firepower just to protect mother nature.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: I have my orders. And a license to execute them as a I see fit. I suggest you forget what you saw, what you think you saw for your own well being.

speaker: MULDER
line: You've got a downed craft in those woods, sir. And troops carrying live rounds ! We both know what's out there!

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Are you MUFON or CUFOS? Do you mind if I sit down? Let me guess you're with that new group--CSICOP, right? Um, say no more. You're a cautious man. Trust no one. Very wise. After what happened to JFK I understand completely. Oh, let me introduce myself. My name is Max Fenig. I'm with the National Investigative Committee of Arial Phenomenon...NICAP . Pleased...pleased to make you're acquanitance. Wish we could shake on it, you know. Firm grip, look you right in the eye. You learn a lot about a guy that way. Hey, uh... Can I ask you a question?

speaker: MULDER
line: Go ahead.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Did you see anything? Did you get close? Me, I saw nothing. I didn't see anything! Nada, zip. Hundred yards past the road block they nailed me. I have no idea how they did it. I'm telling you its like the Roswell cover up all over again.

speaker: MULDER
line: What makes you so sure that something's out there?

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Same thing that makes you so sure?

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't order room service.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This isn't funny, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you meet Max?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who?

speaker: MULDER
line: Max from NICAP. Oh, they must have released him. Another intrepid soul in seach of a close enounter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that what this is about?

speaker: MULDER
line: What else?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Try explaining that to Section Cheif McGrath. He stepped over Blevins ordering a full inquiry. With a recommendation...Mulder he wants to shut down the X-files. And he wants you out of the bureau.

speaker: MULDER
line: So what else is new?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand you Mulder. Why you're always defying protocol? Ignoring jurisdiction...

speaker: MULDER
line: Because I know what I saw Scully. There weren't train tracks anywhere near that site. So how could it have been a derailed container?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because it wasn't. What you saw was not a toxic spill. But it wasn't a UFO either.

speaker: MULDER
line: OK. I'm all ears. What was it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was a downed Libyan jet with a nuclear warhead. Over US air space... They'd been picking up low grade levels of radiation indicating that a plutonium casing may have cracked. So to avoid mass panic...

speaker: MULDER
line: You really believe that story..?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That story happens to be highly classified.

speaker: MULDER
line: A highly classified lie. They're searching for someone Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If they're searching for anyone, its probably the pilot.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think they'd roll out all of this material for one Libyan fighter jock? Besides, no human pilot walked away from the wreckage I saw.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe he ejected.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You can't be serious!

speaker: MULDER
line: As long as we're here in beuartiful downtown Townsend, why not?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, the hearing is tomorrow morning at ten o'clock.

speaker: MULDER
line: That gives us 24 hours to investigate.

speaker: SCULLY
line: My assignment is to bring you back, not to help you dig yourself in deeper.

speaker: MULDER
line: "The Last Detail" starring Dana Scully

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's going on?

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks like housekeeping hasn't been here yet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who would...

speaker: MULDER
line: SH...

speaker: MULDER
line: Max?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get your hands up!

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Whoa. Don't shoot. Don't shoot.

speaker: MULDER
line: Max?

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Ahem..

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: My apologies. Forgive me please. I'm a curious man. I had to know..

speaker: MULDER
line: Know what?

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: If it was really you.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you don't know me. Last night is the first time you've laid eyes on me.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Not true. We at NICAP have been following your career really closely. Ever since you became involved with the X-files.

speaker: MULDER
line: Following my career? How?

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Through the Freedom of Information Act.Your travel expenses are a matter of public record. So, this must be the enigmatic Agent Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did you recognize me?

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: I saw your picture in a trade magazine once. And of course I read your article in Omni about the Gulf Breeze sightings.

speaker: MULDER
line: I published that under a pseudonym.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: M.F. Luder. I know. M.F. Luder is an anagram for F. Mulder. You really didn't think that would fool us did you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't think anyone was really paying attention

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Somebody's always paying attention Mr. Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A-mazing.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Amazing? Hardly. You want to see something amazing? Come with me.

speaker: MULDER
line: *Enigmatic* Dr. Scully.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: This is my, uh...Right this way.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Okay. Where's those, uh...They were right here. Oh, here they are. The latest crop circle photos from Project Argus. Huh? Your opinion fact or fraud.

speaker: MULDER
line: Fraud.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: How do you explain the anamolous blisters on the plants?

speaker: MULDER
line: Some unreported weathering effects common to wheat or a systematic reaction to the plant tissue to being lodged in one position.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: I see you've read the literature.

speaker: MULDER
line: I try to keep up.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: What about the...

speaker: MULDER
line: Max! You said you had something to show us.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Oh, yeah, yeah, yeah. Wolf Ear 2000. Did you ever hear of this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Wolf Industries supplied the CIA with all of its surveillance equipment.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: State of the art, search and intercept. Up to 100 channels per second. Currently I'm jacked into local fire and police departments, cellular pathways, and when the weather's right sometimes even air traffic control from Whitmarsh Air Force Base.

speaker: MULDER
line: What have you got Max?

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Mobil Unit Broadcast. In Scan Mode. Townshend Shariff's deparment. Two nights ago. We got a fire of county road D7. Two miles west of the canyon ridge intersection. Suggest we dispatch fire crews, over? This is Deputy Wright. Do you copy?

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: And this. 35 minutes later. Presumably from the fire crew. Reception got wiggy for some reason. This is unit 53. Man down. Request medivac. I said request medivac! You're breaking up! Very. Bad. VERY bad. Wait a second. What the hell? Charlie, we've got a situation here!

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: We put up a tight net. Yes sir. Every inch of ground is being covered, dug up, squeezed and sifted. No, sir. It will not get away. Not this time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Wright? Hi. I'm Fox Mulder. This is Dana Scully. We're from the FBI. We'd like to ask you a few questions about your husband.

speaker: MRS WRIGHT
line: He's dead. What else is there to know?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry about your husband.

speaker: MRS WRIGHT
line: Oh, please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs. Wright, we want to help you.

speaker: MRS WRIGHT
line: Then leave me alone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why won't you let us help you?

speaker: MRS WRIGHT
line: I don't know anything! Don't you understand? They won't even release the body so I can give him a proper burial. OK?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The government can't do that. I'm sure if you appealed to...

speaker: MRS WRIGHT
line: No!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're entitled to the truth.

speaker: MRS WRIGHT
line: I can't afford the truth. They said that if I spoke to anyone, they would withhold my husband's pension. And I have a child to take care of.

speaker: MILITARY POLICEMAN
line: Picking up extremely high frequency signal--200,000 Mhz Sir, target. onthe northeast side, Footspeed-- seven miles per hour sir

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Beta team

speaker: BETA TEAM LEADER
line: Copy

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Target entering your section from the southwest. Search and destroy. Repeat, Search and Destroy

speaker: BETA TEAM LEADER
line: Yes sir!

speaker: BETA TEAM LEADER
line: : Jackson?

speaker: JACKSON
line: Nothing.

speaker: BETA TEAM LEADER
line: Must have been an animal.

speaker: DR. OPPENHEIM
line: I'm sorry, but unless you have a subpoena I can't discuss patient information.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Does that mean Jason Wright was your patient?

speaker: DR. OPPENHEIM
line: It means I have nothing more to say about this.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about his wife and child, Doctor? Would you have anything to say to them? Because whoever got to you also got to her. They must have some pretty big threats. What did they hold over your head? Your medical licence, the IRS?

speaker: DR. OPPENHEIM
line: I hate fascists.

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me?

speaker: DR. OPPENHEIM
line: The men who came in here. The way they pushed us all around.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Oppenheim. Tell us about the deputy. You saw him that night, didn't you?

speaker: DR. OPPENHEIM
line: Yes. And three others from the fire crew. They were all DOA with 5th and 6th degree burns over 90 percent of their bodies. Although they weren't like any burns I've ever seen. And they took the bodies away before we could perform any pathologies.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you note any cadaver acute heat rigor or heat stiffening?

speaker: DR. OPPENHEIM
line: Yes, actually there was quite a bit of heat inflection in the limbs. How do you know so much about it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Doctor, in your opinion, could those burns have been caused by ionizing radiation?

speaker: DR. OPPENHEIM
line: Well, I hadn't thought...I suppose its possible. If the exposure was significantly intense.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lets say those men died from radiation exposure. Couldn't it have been from the cracked core of a nuclear warhead?

speaker: MULDER
line: I've read about these kinds of burns, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, so have I. In Hiroshima at Ground Zero.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm talking about close encounter mortalities. I have a stack of X-files recording the same clinical results.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder I don't claim to know all the answers, but if we don't make the OPR inquest by tomorrow morning, there may not be any more X-files.

speaker: DR. OPPENHEIM
line: Start an IV here stat.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell us what happened out there?

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Whatever happened, Mulder, it has nothing to do with you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wrong colonel. We both want the same thing. Only you want it dead. Can't you see that chasing it down like an animal you leave it no choice but to defend itself? How many more people have to die before you rethink your approach?

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Listen to me. Cause I'm not wasting another breath on this. If you and your partner aren't out of here in 30 seconds...

speaker: DR. OPPENHEIM
line: Agent Scully stays right here. We're undermanned. She's a medical doctor. She stays. If that's OK with you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Of course, I...

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Doctor, if you don't mind, you just take care of my men, and let me do my work, OK?

speaker: DR. OPPENHEIM
line: Outside this emergency room, you can do whatever you want, But in here I call the shots. Assuming of course, you want me to take care of your men.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Get this man out of my sight!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll scrub up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Max? Hey, Max. Max?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey... Max

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Who...who are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Max.. Its me. Fox Mulder.. Are you OK?

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: You were haveing some kind of seizure.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Seizure? That's impossible.

speaker: MULDER
line: You were lying on the floor. Unconscious. Convulsing.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Thats odd. I haven't had an episode in seven years. Not since I went on medication.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lets get you to the hospital.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: No! I mean, I mean its not necessary.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you sure?

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Yeah. I've lived with epilepsy all my life. I'm not in any danger.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Yeah. It started in South Dakota when I was ten. The doctor said I must have incurred a head injury. I don't remember hitting my head.

speaker: MULDER
line: And when you have a seizure, you have no memory of it?

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: As a kid I used to wake up in strange places with no idea where I was, or how I got there. Sorry I... I've got to get some sleep.

speaker: MULDER
line: Rough night, huh?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was terrible. We lost all but two. And they're still in critical condition on their way to the burn unit at John's Hopkins.

speaker: MULDER
line: So what do you think, Scully? What's going on out there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. And under other circumstances, I would like to find out, but we have a plane to catch in just over an hour...

speaker: MULDER
line: I want you to take a look at something first.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Max. There's an unsual incision bechind his left ear. I've seen this incision twice before. Two women. A thousand miles apart. No way of knowing each other. No relation. Both claim to have been abducted by aliens.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you saying Max Fenig is an abductee? Mulder, the man is taking powerful anti-psychotic drugs. I saw them in his RV.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're for his epilepsy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not all of them. DILANTIN is an anti-convulsant, but MELLARIL is used exclusively to treat schitzophrenia. More than likely, Max is delusional.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't seem to understand Scully. Max doesn't believe he was abducted by aliens, I believe he was. Now could you at least take a look at the scar, and give me you medical opinion?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. You pack. I'll take a look at Max...on the way to the airport.

speaker: CAPTAIN KORETZ
line: Sir I have flash traffic at 24-18. Repeated calls for ID go unanswered. And its not in the orbital or suborbital inventory.

speaker: MILITARY OFFICER #2
line: 24-18. Isn't that where...

speaker: CAPTAIN KORETZ
line: Same exact spot sir. Although I am reading a much larger craft his time.

speaker: MILITARY OFFICER #2
line: Meteor, Ms. Koretz.

speaker: CAPTAIN KORETZ
line: A much larger Meteor, sir. Hold on a second. We have a confirm. Whitmarsh Air Force BAse is tracking...

speaker: MILITARY OFFICER #2
line: Where is it?

speaker: CAPTAIN KORETZ
line: Well, sir. The meteor, seems to be hovering over a small town in Eastern Wisconsin.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Come on, Mulder. Lets get this over with.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Max. Max!

speaker: MULDER
line: Max?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder - look at this.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is that, blood? Mulder and Scully stand in front of the scanner, looking and listening.

speaker: SCANNER
line: Repeat.......patrol reporting unidentified tresspass at the waterfront. This is Henderson. Move on target.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where do you think you are going? Look, if we go to the airport right now, we might make the plane. Which would at least give you half a chance of defending yourself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Think about is Scully. Max is a gypsy. A nomad, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, so what?

speaker: MULDER
line: So he intercepted Deputy Wright's last call to his dispatcher. Which means he was here in Townsend Wisconsin the night of the crash. Of all the places he could of been, he was right here. Don't you think thats more than a coincidence. If Max was abducted that would go a long way to explaining his obsession. And if we've figured it out, you can be sure Col. Henderson has as well. Do you have the keys?

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Don't do this.

speaker: ARMY MAN 1
line: Sir, we've apprehended the target. Its just a civilian.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Negative, Falcon patrol. Take him with extreme caution.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're dead.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: It hurts. It hurts. Please stop. It hurts.

speaker: MULDER
line: Max?

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: It hurts. It hurts.

speaker: MULDER
line: Max. Its alright.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: It hurts. Stop it. No, no. It's me they... They're coming for me. Now I know....They're coming for me. That's why they're here.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: gets out of jeep.)

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Alpha team, secure the room.

speaker: OFFCAMERA
line: Stop right there. Put your hands up, and come with us.

speaker: ALPHA TEAM LEADER
line: Alpha team ready on the roof.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Roger alpha .

speaker: DELTA TEAM LEADER
line: Delta team in position sir.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing? You have a very sick man in there.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: We're not in the hospital now, Doctor Scully.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Omega team report.

speaker: OMEGA TEAM LEADER
line: Omega Team in position.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's a delusional schitzophrenic.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Keep her clear!

speaker: ALPHA TEAM LEADER
line: Sir, this is Alpha Team Leader. I'm picking up three forms inside the structure.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Did you say three forms?

speaker: ALPHA TEAM LEADER
line: Two are proximate. The third approaching from 30 meters.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: All teams prepare to go in 30 seconds

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on. Come on, Max.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Why... Stop. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm hear to help you.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: I'm scared.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: Don't let them take me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I won't let them take you. Come on, Max. Come with me.

speaker: MAX FENIG
line: NO!!

speaker: MULDER
line: Max! Max! MAX!

speaker: ALPHA TEAM LEADER
line: Sir this is Alpha team leader. Except for our men, I'm only picking one figure inside.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: I *Do Not* copy that.

speaker: ALPHA TEAM LEADER
line: We indicate only one figure inside the building.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?!

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Blow the door!

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Where is he?

speaker: MULDER
line: He's gone. They got to him first. They beat us Colonel.

speaker: COLONEL CALVIN HENDERSON
line: Arrest him...and keep looking.

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: Agent Scully, to the best of your knowledge was Agent Mulder ever assigned to investigate matters related to the evacuation of Townshend, Wisconson?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: At any time were you aware of his submitting a form 302 requesting said assignment or travel expenses?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir.

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: While in Wisconsin, did Agent Mulder drive a blue Ford Taurus registered to the state car rental agency.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: Thank you, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir. Request permision to make a statement.

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: Request denied.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, its unfair to judge Mulder by the same criteria...

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: You're dismissed Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But sir, I...

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: THAT will be all.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you hear that sound Scully? Hammer and nails. They're building a gallows in the town square. Don't worry. It was only a matter of time. I'm surprised I lasted this long.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good luck

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll break a leg. to their homes)

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: ...as well as insubordination and misconduct. How do you respond to these allegations, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Over a dozen men lost their lives and you want me to respond to issues of protocol?

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: You failed to obtain proper authorization for your actions.

speaker: MULDER
line: Because I knew it wouldn't be forthcoming.

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: You also violated a federal quarantine....

speaker: MULDER
line: A cover up was underway...

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: ...exposing yourself and possibly others to toxic contamination.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, toxic contamination? Are we back in that? You read my report, explain the disapearance of Max Fenig.

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: Your report is not the subject of this inquiry...

speaker: MULDER
line: I have further evidence to support my conclusions -- X-rays taken while Mr. Fenig was institutionalized show an object lodged in his cerrebelum

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: That is irrelevant Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: The man was abducted. We all know it. Everybody in this room knows it.

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: Colonel Henderson's written testimony states that Fenig's body was found two hours later in a cargo container.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then what can I say? How can I disprove lies that are stamped with an official seal?

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: That will be all Mr. Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: You can deny all the things I've seen. All the things I've discovered. But not for much longer. Because too many others know what's happening out there. And no one. No government agency has jurisdiction over the truth.

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: Why did you countermand my decision? Mulder's conduct was in clear violation not only of bureau procedures but of federal law.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Yes.

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: I don't understand. The committee's case was air tight. You've ruined the last best chance we had to get rid of him.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: I appreciate your frustration, but you and I both know Mulder's work is a singular passion -- poses a most unique dilemma. But his occasional insubordination is in the end, far less dangerous.

speaker: SECTION CHIEF MCGRATH
line: With respect sir, less dangerous than what?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Than having him exposed to the wrong people.What he knows...... what he thinks he knows... Always keep your friends close, Mr. McGrath... but keep your enemies closer.
